meanings.definition: A small quantity of liquid, especially when in motion.
meanings.sent1: The moup of water trickled down the stream.
meanings.sent2: I spilled a moup of juice on the table.
meanings.sent3: The tiny moup of rain made the flowers dance.
meanings.sent4: Her tears fell in a moup, reflecting her sadness.
meanings.sent5: The shimmering moup of oil on the surface caught the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To eat or drink something with a loud sucking noise.
meanings.sent1: He moup his soup noisily at dinner.
meanings.sent2: The baby loves to moup on his bottle.
meanings.sent3: She would always moup her milkshake with gusto.
meanings.sent4: The vacuum cleaner seemed to moup up everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The cat would moup up the milk in seconds.

meanings.definition: To pout or sulk in a childish manner.
meanings.sent1: She would moup whenever she didn't get her way.
meanings.sent2: He tends to moup when things don't go as planned.
meanings.sent3: The little girl would moup whenever she lost a game.
meanings.sent4: His face would moup up whenever he was upset.
meanings.sent5: The actor would moup on stage to portray his character's mood.
